content.description:
Charioteering tactics

1 Genus hoc est ex essedisessedum, -i, n.: two-wheeled war-chariot pugnae. Primo per omnes

partes perequitantperequito, -are: ride through, ride about et tela coiciunt atque ipso terrore

equorum et strepitu rotarum ordines plerumque

perturbant, et cum se inter equitum turmasturma, -ae, f.: troop, crowd

5 insinuaverunt,insinuo, -are: make a way ex essedis desiliunt et pedibus

proeliantur. Aurigaeauriga, -ae, m.: charioteer interim paulatim ex proelio

excedunt atque ita currus conlocant ut, si illi

a multitudine hostium premantur, expeditum

ad suos receptumreceptus, -us, m.: means of retreat habeant.
content.question: A typical feature of Caesar’s Commentarii found in this passage is

choices.label: an address by Caesar to his soldiers before a battle

skill.text: 2.A: Describe features and functions of stylistic elements in Latin texts.
